greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: One half of the fundamental positive solution y = y1(n) of the first class of the Pell equation x^2 - 2*y^2 = -A007522(n), n >= 1 (primes congruent to 7 mod 8).
comment: For the corresponding term x1(n) see A254938(n).
See A254938 also for the Nagell reference.
The least positive y solutions (that is those of the first class) for the primes +1 and -1 (mod 8) together (including prime 2) are given in A255246.
formula: A254938(n)^2 - 2*(2*a(n))^2 = -A007522(n) gives the smallest positive (proper) solution of this (generalized) Pell equation.
results.author: _Wolfdieter Lang_, Feb 18 2015
